venue.address_1: At the end of Zealand Road
venue.name: Zealand Parking Lot
venue.address_3: drive to the end and park in the lots

item.description:
Join us for a relaxed paced White Mountain hike that loops via Mt Hale, Zealand Falls Hut, Zealand Falls and Zealand Pond.


Our Hike Plan:
We will meet at the Zealand trailhead which is the end of our hike, leave some cars and carpool back down to the Hale Brook parking lot to the start of the hike

This trail climbs from Zealand Rd. (FR 16), at a parking area, to the clearing at the summit of Mt. Hale, where there are restricted views over trees that have been steadily reclaiming the formerly bare summit in the more than 40 years since the fire tower was removed. The trail is relatively easy, with moderate grades and good footing, and passes through a very fine birch forest much of the way.

Trivia: The summit of Mt Hale is magnetic and will give your confuse your compass! fun. We will get a little view here but the better views will be at Zealand.

From here we will hike to the Lend A Hand Trail.
This trail connects Zealand Falls Hut with the summit of Mt. Hale, which offers some restricted views over trees that are steadily growing taller. The grade is fairly easy but the footing is rather rough for a good part of its distance, because there are a great many plank walkways across a very wet section. The trail takes its name from a journal for charitable organizations that was edited by Edward Everett Hale, the Boston pastor and author for whom Mt. Hale was named.

Our next trail will be Twinway. The trail offers magnificent views from the summits of South Twin Mountain and Mt. Guyot and from the outlook at Zeacliff, and connecting trails lead to a number of other superb outlooks. For its entire length, it is part of the AT. On my two trips to the Bonds, I found this area a nice place to hang out at.

This stretch of trail forms a very important ridge crest link along the north edge of the Pemigewasset Wilderness that connects the mountains of the western part of the region—the Franconia Range, Garfield, and the Twins—to the Bonds, the Zealand-Hale region, the Willey Range, and the northern parts of the Pemigewasset Wilderness.

Our next stop will be the AMC Zealand Falls Hut. This hut, built in 1932, is located at 2,630 ft. We will break here and replenish water supplies before our descend back to the cars via the relatively easy Zealand trail.


starting at Hale Brook Trailhead
hike 2.20 mi/2 hr 15 min/+2276 ft on the Hale Brook Trail to Mt Hale
hike 2.70 mi/2 hr 4 min/-1382 ft on the Lend-A-Hand Trail to the junction of Twinway
hike 0.08 mi/3 min/-56 ft on the Twinway to AMC Zealand Falls Hut
hike 0.20 mi/7 min/-151 ft on the Twinway to Zealand Pond
hike 0.20 mi/6 min/+3 ft on the Zealand Trail to the junction of A-Z Trail
hike 2.30 mi/1 hr 24 min/-431 ft on the Zealand Trail to Zealand Trailhead

Totals
Distance 7.68 mi
AMC Book Time 5 hr 59 min add time for breaks and hiker pace.
Elev Gain +2468 ft
Elev Loss -2209 ft
Elev Change +259 ft
item.name: Mt Hale, Zealand Falls and Zealand Pond
